title: Charles Fitzgerald (rugby)
text:
Charles James Fitzgerald (6 June 1899, in <a href="Fairhall">Fairhall</a> – 8 May 1961, in <a href="Awatere%20Valley">Awatere Valley</a>) was a New Zealand <a href="List%20of%20dual-code%20rugby%20internationals">dual-code international</a> <a href="rugby%20football">rugby football</a>er who represented New Zealand in <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">rugby union</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">rugby league</a>. Fitzgerald was a utility back in both codes.
Rugby union career.
Fitzgerald represented <a href="Marlborough%20Rugby%20Union">Marlborough</a> between 1917 and 1921, appearing for the union in every backline position except fullback. He played for a combined <a href="Nelson%20Rugby%20Union">Nelson</a>-<a href="Marlborough%20Rugby%20Union">Marlborough</a>-<a href="Golden%20Bay-Motueka%20Rugby%20Union">Golden Bay-Motueka</a> side against the 1921 <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Springboks</a> kicking a penalty goal in the side's 26–3 defeat. In that game he lined up alongside fellow future dual-international <a href="Andrew%20O%27Brien%20%28rugby%29">Jim O'Brien</a>.
Fitzgerald played for the <a href="South%20Island%20rugby%20union%20team">South Island</a> in 1922, scoring a try in the inter-island match. Following this he was selected for <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a>, playing in five matches on a tour of New Zealand and Australia. Fitzgerald represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> (RU) in the 12–11 victory over <a href="Wairarapa%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Wairarapa</a> at <a href="Carterton%2C%20New%20Zealand">Carterton</a> on 19 July 1922, the 26–19 victory over <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20Union">New South Wales</a> at Sydney on 29 July 1922, the 24–6 victory over Metropolitan Union at Sydney on 2 August 1922, the 6–8 defeat by <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20Union">New South Wales</a> at Sydney on 7 August 1922, and scored a <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%20union%29">penalty</a> in the 45–11 victory over <a href="Manawatu%20Rugby%20Union">Manawatu</a>-<a href="Wellington%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Wellington</a> XV at <a href="Palmerston%20North">Palmerston North</a> on 16 August 1922 but never played a Test match for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand national rugby union team</a>.
In 1923 Fitzgerald moved to <a href="Christchurch">Christchurch</a>, joining the Marist Old Boys club. However the club was expelled from the <a href="Canterbury%20Rugby%20Union">Canterbury Rugby Union</a> in April 1924 and Fitzgerald followed to club to <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a>.
Rugby league career.
Fitzgerald excelled in rugby league and in his debut year he made the national side, playing in two Test matches against <a href="Great%20Britain%20Lions">Great Britain</a>. He played for the <a href="South%20Island%20rugby%20league%20team">South Island</a> in 1925.
